snippets: St John’s Wort (Hypericum perforatum) is a potent inducer of CYP2C9 and CYP3A4, reducing warfarin plasma concentration and INR. Concomitant use is contraindicated; if exposure occurs, increase frequency of INR monitoring until stable. (BNF Interactions, accessed 20 Jun 2025)
Herbal preparations of St John’s Wort interact with many medicines including warfarin. Advise patients to discontinue the herb and seek medical review. (NICE CKS: Depression, 2024 update)
